body_content.explanation: a hard, cow's milk cheese that is very pale yellow, almost white in colour and crumbles (= breaks into pieces) easily, originally made in Wales:
examples: End the meal with a chunk of Caerphilly with a drizzle of honey and some bread.
Bake the tarts, then top with grated caerphilly cheese.
This artisan Caerphilly cheese has a full and luscious taste, resulting from the cows' rich diet.
The caerphilly was made on a farm near the town.
